'

column20:
'(CDIM)
Sturdy shackles forged of cold iron with runes traced in gold upon the surface. Any creature restrained with the shackles will be bound to the Prime Material Plane
column21: no save allowed
column22: until the shackles are removed. The imprisoned creature will be unable to use any spells or spell-like abilities
column23: including summoning spells
column24: which require contact with any plane of existence besides the Prime Material. The shackles will size to fit any creature.'

column20:
'(any)
A pair of kettle drums about 18 in around
column21: mounted on stands. A simply-scribed “K” can be seen on both drum-heads when light hits the skin from a certain angle. When both drums are sounded all creatures more than 20 ft and less than 120 ft away are affected by a fear spell
column22: saving throw for reduced effects. Creatures in the 20 ft safe zone are completely unaffected. The drums of panic can be sounded once per day.'

column20:
'(any)
Simply put
column21: this fine white powder makes things visible. A handful of this substance projected into the air coats all objects within a 10 ft radius and lasts 5 minutes
column22: making even invisible objects appear in plain sight. Within the area of effect the dust negates: invisibility
column23: blur
column24: displacement
column25: phantasms
column26: mirror images
column27: projected images
column28: and illusions—even a hiding creature incurs a -30% penalty on its chance to hide in shadows. Dust of appearance is typically found stored in sets of 1d4+2 hollowed bone tubes or silk packets.'

column20:
'(any)
This fine white powder makes things invisible
column21: as per the 4th level illusionist spell improved invisibility but with a duration of 2d6 rounds
column22: though the affected creature will not know when the invisibility ends. A creature coated with dust of disappearance cannot be seen by any means mundane or magical with but one exception: dust of appearance will negate the invisibility caused by dust of disappearance. Note also an invisible creature may be detected by other means
column23: such as sound or smell. This item is typically found stored in sets of 1d4+2 hollowed bone tubes or silk packets.'

column20:
'(any)
One application of this wonderful substance will absorb up to 100 gallons of water (fresh
column21: salt
column22: or alkaline) and forming a small 1 in pellet
column23: either floating or resting where it was cast. This pellet can be forcibly hurled
column24: causing it to break open and release the same volume of water in a most energetic fashion. Dust of dryness will only affect water
column25: it has no affect on other liquids. This magic dust can also be used to destroy a water elemental
column26: though the monster is allowed a saving throw vs death magic at -5 for 5d6 damage. Dust of dryness comes packaged in a similar fashion to dust of appearance.'

column20:
'(IM)
When this magic dust is applied to a living creature
column21: the creature alters appearance as per the 1st level illusionist spell change self according to the user’s whim
column22: lasting for 2 hours. An unwilling target may save vs spells to negate. The dust comes in 1d4+1 hollow bone tubes; each tube is one application.'

column20:
'(any)
One application of dust of tracelessness can cause up to 100 sq ft of floor space to become dusty and cobwebbed as if abandoned for years
column21: concealing all evidence of anyone passing through the area. The dust can be used on outdoor trails as well
column22: concealing for 250 ft of back-trail the passage of up to a dozen troops and their mounts. The dust works instantly and leaves no magical aura to betray its use. Any creature with tracking skills
column23: a ranger for instance
column24: will be severely disadvantaged following a path concealed by dust of tracelessness
column25: allow only a 5% chance of a ranger successfully tracking his or her quarry in such a case. This item comes in 1d4+2 silk packets
column26: and can easily be sprinkled along a trail or applied all at once to a larger area.'

column20:
'(AFPRT)
An ordinary-appearing quiver with three compartments
column21: each of which can magically hold many more objects than would seem possible at first look. The first compartment can hold up to 60 arrows or similar objects such as wands. The second compartment can hold up to 18 javelins or magic rods. The third compartment can hold six bows or similarly sized objects such as spears or staves. When the wearer reaches into the quiver
column22: whatever object is desired will be produced.'

column21:
'(DM)
An enchanted gem keyed to one of the four major Elemental Planes. Its appearance varies by plane. Air elemental gems are crystal clear
column22: earth elemental gems are brown
column23: fire elemental gems are bright red
column24: water elemental gems are turquoise. Smashing the gem releases a 16 hit dice elemental which will serve the player of its own free will and follow his or her commands to the best of its ability
column25: including fighting any foe the player designates. The elemental lasts for 2 hours or until dispelled or destroyed.'

column21:
'(DM)
An enchanted gem keyed to one of the four major Elemental Planes. Its appearance varies by plane. Air elemental gems are crystal clear
column22: earth elemental gems are brown
column23: fire elemental gems are bright red
column24: water elemental gems are turquoise. Smashing the gem releases a 16 hit dice elemental which will serve the player of its own free will and follow his or her commands to the best of its ability
column25: including fighting any foe the player designates. The elemental lasts for 2 hours or until dispelled or destroyed.'

column21:
'(DM)
An enchanted gem keyed to one of the four major Elemental Planes. Its appearance varies by plane. Air elemental gems are crystal clear
column22: earth elemental gems are brown
column23: fire elemental gems are bright red
column24: water elemental gems are turquoise. Smashing the gem releases a 16 hit dice elemental which will serve the player of its own free will and follow his or her commands to the best of its ability
column25: including fighting any foe the player designates. The elemental lasts for 2 hours or until dispelled or destroyed.'

column21:
'(DM)
An enchanted gem keyed to one of the four major Elemental Planes. Its appearance varies by plane. Air elemental gems are crystal clear
column22: earth elemental gems are brown
column23: fire elemental gems are bright red
column24: water elemental gems are turquoise. Smashing the gem releases a 16 hit dice elemental which will serve the player of its own free will and follow his or her commands to the best of its ability
column25: including fighting any foe the player designates. The elemental lasts for 2 hours or until dispelled or destroyed.'

column20:
'(any)
This potion enables the drinker to breathe fire up to thrice
column21: targeting a single creature up to 25 ft away for 4d6 damage per attack. The target gets a saving throw vs dragon breath for half damage. The ability to breathe fire dissipates after 3 breath attacks or 1 hour
column22: whichever comes first.'

column20:
'(any)
Imbibing this potion grants a non-thief character the hide in shadows ability of a 10th level thief for 1 hour. A thief character of 10th level or above drinking the potion gains a 20% bonus to hide in shadows checks for the same period.'

'(any)
Anyone drinking this liquid ignores all clothing
column21: armour
column22: equipment
column23: or any other type of encumbrance while swimming for a period of 1 hour. Thus
column24: an individual wearing plate armour and wearing a fully loaded backpack can swim as if in his or her small clothes. Note that this potion does not grant any magical ability to breathe underwater.'

column20:
'(any)
Drinking this elixir will cause one to answer any question truthfully for a period of 10 minutes
column21: though a resisting imbiber is allowed a save vs magic to negate. While under the influence of the potion a person will answer 1 question per round and a secondary save for each question is rolled. The secondary save
column22: if successful
column23: allows the drinker of the potion to decline to answer that question but does not negate the elixir’s effects. The law courts and city patrols in more lawful areas favour use of this potion. NB: This potion does not give the drinker any knowledge he or she would not otherwise possess—so some questions will elicit the answer
column24: “I don’t know”.'

column20:
'(any)
The drinker of this potion will detect secret and concealed doors and similarly hidden objects like an elf for 1 hour.'

'(any)
This item looks exactly like an afreeti bottle but
column21: when unstoppered
column22: thick grey smoke begins to issue forth from the bottle. Vision within 50 ft of the bottle will be impossible in 1 round
column23: and each consecutive round the radius of the smoke cloud increases 10 ft until a maximum of 100 ft has been reached. The smoke cannot be dispelled until the bottle is restoppered and the command word is spoken. The smoke dispels in about an hour
column24: although a moderate wind will disperse the smoke in 5 rounds
column25: and a gust of wind spell will remove it in 1 round.'

column20:
'(IM)
The eyes of charming are a pair of crystal lenses which fit over the eyes
column21: granting charm person as a gaze attack. A saving throw is allowed vs spells to negate. If only one lens is used
column22: saving throw is at +5.'

column20:
'(IM)
Eye lenses which cause an intense feeling of dread as a gaze attack against a single target. The target is allowed a saving throw vs petrifaction to negate. Failing the saving throw means the victim will always attack last in combat and morale checks are at -10%. The use of both lenses allows additional powers. First
column21: the wearer can determine of anyone within 30 ft whether they are: dead
column22: undead
column23: feigning death
column24: neither (golems
column25: for instance)
column26: near death (3 or fewer hit points remaining)
column27: or wounded (4 or more hit points but less than 100%). The wearer can also use fear as a gaze attack once per week
column28: saving throw vs petrifaction allowed. The fear attack is powerful
column30: and a target making its save is still -1 to all attacks
column31: damage

column20:
'(IM)
Wearing both of these crystal lenses allows the user to detect secret and concealed doors and similarly hidden objects as an elf. These lenses work best in pairs. Wearing only 1 will cause a person to become dizzy
column21: drop anything carried in the hands
column22: become unable to take any action
column23: lose any dexterity bonus to AC
column24: and incur a -2 AC penalty. Covering the unlensed eye will prevent this effect.'

column20:
'(IM)
This item is only effective when used in pairs
column21: granting a petrifaction gaze attack 10 times per day. A saving throw is allowed vs petrifaction to negate effects.'

'(any)
A small feather ensorcelled to provide a specific item suitable for a special need. A feather token is a single-use item.
  • Anchor: Becomes a magical anchor which will render a water craft immobile for 1 day. Market value is 50 gp.
  • Bird: Transforms into a magical carrier pigeon capable of unerringly bearing a message to its intended recipient. The transformation lasts until the message is delivered. Market value is 300 gp.
  • Fan: Creates a huge fan which generates a breeze sufficient to propel one ship at approx 25 mph. Though this wind is not cumulative with existing winds
column22:
the fan can be used to decrease existing wind to create an area of calm. Note that such a usage will not decrease wave size. The fan can be used for up to 8 hours and will not function on land. Market value is 200 gp.
  • Swan Boat: Creates a swan-like boat capable of sailing at 60 ft and carrying 8 mounted troops and their gear or up to 32 Medium sized characters. The boat lasts for 1 day. Market value is 450 gp.
  • Tree: Causes a great oak to spring into being. The tree has a 5 ft diameter trunk
column23: is 60 ft tall
column24:
and has a 40 ft diameter of branches at its widest point. This is a permanent transformation. Market value is 400 gp.
  • Whip: Forms a dancing weapon that will wield itself against any opponent designated by the user
column25: attacking as a 10th level fighter and doing 1d6+1 damage. The whip is a +1 weapon and lasts for 1 hour. Market value is 500 gp.'

column21:
'(any)
Tiny and skilfully-carved statuettes of creatures in various materials and forms. When the figurine is placed or thrown on the ground and the command word spoken
column22: the statuette becomes a living creature its form resembles. Destroying a statuette shatters the magic; killing the living creature it forms causes the creature to revert to its smaller
column23:
figurine form.
  • Bronze Griffon: Becomes a griffon under command of the user. This figurine can be used twice per week with a time of 6 hours per use. When this time expires or the command word is spoken
column24: the griffin reverts to statuette form. Market value is 10
column25:
000 gp.
  • Ebony Fly: Becomes a fly the size of a pony with hit dice and movement rate of a hippogriff but unable to make any attacks. The fly can be used up to 3 times per week for 12 hours each use. Market value is 10
column26:
000 gp.
  • Golden Lions: These figurines always come in a pair
column27: becoming normal adult male lions on command. The lions can be used once per day for up to 1 hour
column28: though if slain in combat the lions are unusable for 1 week. Market value is 16
column29:
500 gp.
  • Ivory Goats: A trio of figurines
column30: similar but distinct from one another and filling different functions. Market value is 21
column31:
000 gp.
  • The Goat of Travelling: A goat large enough to ride
column32:
with all the statistics and attacks of a heavy warhorse. This goat can travel for a cumulative 24 hours each week.
  • The Goat of Travail: Becomes a very large goat with the statistics of a nightmare plus two horn attacks for 1d8+4 each. The goat of travail also has a charging attack in which it can use its 2 horn attacks only but adding +6 damage to damage rolls. This figurine can be used once a month for up to 12 hours.
  • The Goat of Terror: This figurine becomes a goat large enough to ride
column33:
with the statistics of a light warhorse. The rider can use the goat’s horns as weapons. The left one functions as a lance +2 and the right as a +3 longsword. When ridden in combat the goat of terror radiates fear (as the spell) in a 30 ft radius. A save vs spells negates this. This figurine can be used once a fortnight for up to 3 hours total.
  • Marble Elephant: This particular figurine is larger than the others
column34: about the size of an adult human hand. The command word causes the statuette to become a full grown elephant. The elephant can function as a beast of burden
column36: or a combatant and will obey the user’s command. The marble elephant is usable four times per month for a period of up to 24 hours each use. Market value is 21
column37:
000 gp.
  • Obsidian Steed: Unlike the other figurines of wondrous power
column38: this particular figurine appears as a shapeless black rock. Close inspection
column39: however
column40: will reveal a vague resemblance to a horse. Upon command this statuette becomes a heavy warhorse with the following special abilities
column41: usable at will once each per round: first
column42: the steed can fly up to 40 ft per round
column43: 30 ft if rider is wearing heavy armour. Second
column45: the mount and its rider (and equipment) can become æthereal. This statuette can be used once per week for up to 24 hours. Market value is 28
column46:
500 gp.
  • Onyx Dog: This statuette becomes a large dog similar to a war dog but with an intelligence of 8
column47: the ability to track as a 10th level ranger
column49: and can see invisible. The onyx dog is large and strong enough to bear a small creature as a rider. Market value is 15
column50:
500 gp.
  • Serpentine Owl: With the proper command word
column51: this statuette becomes either a horned owl or a giant owl. This transformation can take place once per day for up to 8 hours. The owl will communicate all it sees and hears to its owner via telepathic means but
column53: after three transformations into giant owl form
column54: the statuette crumbles into useless dust. Market value is 9
column55:
100 gp.
  • Silver Raven: Upon command this figurine becomes a raven but retains it silvery metallic surface
column56: giving it an AC 0. The raven can be used as a magical messenger
column57: capable of carrying a message or small token to a designated spot and awaiting the designated recipient of the message. The raven can maintain its animated status for up to 24 hours per week

column22:
'(ACDFPRT)
Similar to a belt of giant strength
column23: the gauntlets of ogre power permit an additional strength bonus—but the effects are lesser than a belt of giant strength
column24: being +1d3 “to hit” and +1d6 on damage. The effect of the gauntlets is not cumulative with a belt of giant strength (exception: hammer of thunderbolts) and both gauntlets must be worn to achieve the effect.'

column20:
'(ACDFPRT)
A single item. On a successful hit affects metal objects like a rust monster’s special attack. Protects all metal gear on the wearer’s person from all rust whether mundane or magical
column21: even from a rust monster attack.'

column20:
'(CDIM)
An ordinary prism-shaped crystal with three powers
column21:
activated by command words. The gem’s number of charges is determined in the same way as a rod. It may not be recharged.
  • Light: 30 ft radius
column22:
requires no charges to activate.
  • Ray of light: A ray 1” in diameter and 50 ft long. Blinds a single target for 1d4 rounds; a save vs wand negates. Requires 1 charge.
  • Flare: A 30 ft cone of bright light; creatures within the cone must save vs wands or be blind for 1d4 rounds. Requires 5 charges.
    • '

column20:
'(any)
A finely-cut gem that bestows the benefits of a true seeing spell when looked through. May be used no more than 30 minutes per day.'

'(any)
Extremely light leather gloves that twice per day allow the wearer to snatch a missile out of the air. Both gloves must be worn and at least one hand must be free for the magic to work. Huge missiles
column21: such as a giant-thrown boulder
column22: are unaffected and the wearer must be aware of the attack for the gloves to function. Casting a spell using a somatic component will negate the benefit of these gloves during the round the spell is cast.'

column20:
'(AT)
Supple leather gloves. When both are worn the wearer receives a dexterity bonus of +1.'

'(AT)
A single plain-appearing leather glove. Any item up to 20 lbs of weight held in the hand wearing the glove can be commanded to disappear. The item is actually shrunk down into the palm of the glove and held there in stasis and weightless
column21: though spell effects will continue to accrue expiration time. The item can be commanded to reappear by snapping the fingers. Only one item may be stored at a time.'

column20:
'(any)
Lightweight leather gloves granting the ability to swim at 120 ft and climb walls like a 10th level thief. If the wearer is already a thief of 10th level or above
column21: add +10% to his or her Climb Walls chance instead. Must be used in pairs.'

column20:
'(any)
Crystal magnifying lenses allowing the wearer a 90% chance to detect non-magical traps
column21: secret and concealed doors
column22: and hidden items. Must be used in pairs.'

column20:
'(any)
Dark
column21: opaque crystal lenses which do not impede normal vision in any way. They grant 60 ft infravision. Must be used in pairs.'

'(C)
Allows creation of the type of golem specified in the book’s title. Each manual contains detailed instructions and all necessary spells for creation of a golem
column22: though the cost of the materials to assemble the construct must still be borne by the maker. When the user reaches the final step in the golem creation process the book will burst into flame. Sprinkling the ashes from this magical fire onto the golem activates the construct. There are four kinds: Clay
column23: Flesh
column24: Iron and Stone (roll 1d4 to determine the type found).'

When the user reaches the final step in the golem creation process the book will burst into flame. Sprinkling the ashes from this magical fire onto the golem activates the construct. There are four kinds: Clay
column23: Flesh
column24: Iron and Stone (roll 1d4 to determine the type found).'

column20:
'(any)
A well-made but otherwise plain leather haversack with two side pouches and brass hardware. Each side pouch functions as a bag of holding and both will hold up to either 20 cubic ft of material or 20 lbs in weight. The main part of the haversack can hold up to 80 cubic ft of material or 80 lbs of weight. No matter how much material is placed into the handy haversack it will never weigh more than 5 lbs. When the user reaches into the pack for a specific item
column21: that item will always be on top.'

column20:
'(any)
A harp that enables the performer to implant a suggestion into the minds of the listeners
column21: at the rate of one suggestion every 10 minutes. Each listener may attempt a saving throw vs spells for each suggestion attempted and anyone saving is immune to the harp for 24 hours.'

column20:
'(any)
On command
column21: alters the wearer’s appearance as per the change self spell. The hat alters itself to blend in with the disguise.'

column20:
'(IM)
Adds +1 to wearer’s intelligence score while worn.'

'(any)
An ordinary appearing helm that transforms into a brightly polished silver helm encrusted with jewels when donned and the command word spoken. The gems are imbued with magic abilities. The powers and numbers of each type of gem appear below.
  • 10 diamonds: Prismatic Spray
  • 20 rubies: Wall of Fire
  • 40 opals: Daylight (60 ft radius
column21: useful against creatures such as vampires or orcs)The helm can be used once per round and each jewel only functions once. As long as charged gems remain
column22:
the helm also has the following powers when activated.
  • Holy Aura: A bluish light causing 1d6 damage per round to any undead within 30 ft.
  • Flaming Weapon: The wearer can command any weapon he or she wields to become a flaming weapon (as the flaming sword). The transformation takes 1 round and stacks with other weapon special abilities unless the weapon already flames for some other reason.
  • Resist Fire: Grants resistance to fire as per the cleric spell
column23: duration 20 rounds.Once all jewels lose their magic
column24: the helm of brilliance transforms back into a mundane helm and all jewels crumble into worthless dust. Any gem removed from the helm also crumbles into dust
column25: whether it is charged or discharged. If the wearer of the helm receives damage from magical fire he or she must save vs breath weapons. Failure indicates a catastrophic release of all remaining charges on the helm as follows: prismatic spray will hit a randomly selected target
column26: including the wearer; wall of fire will radiate out in randomly determined directions; fireballs will centre on the wearer. The helm and its jewels are
column27: of course
column28: destroyed in the process.'

column2: 'Helm of Comprehend Languages and Read Magic'
column20:
'(any)
A normal-appearing helmet that grants its wearer the understanding of spoken languages and the written word
column21: including magic.'

column20:
'(any)
Grants the wearer the 2nd level arcane spell ESP
column21: except the helm also allows two-way telepathic communication between the wearer of the helm and the mind being read. The helm can also implant a suggestion
column22: per the spell (and saving throw allowed)
column23: once per day.'

column20:
'(any)
Grants the wearer the ability teleport up to 3 times per day
column21: as per the spell.'

column20:
'(any)
This helm has two lenses which slide down into place in front of the wearer’s eyes. These thick lenses bestow the ability to see five times further underwater than normally possible for land-dwelling humans and demi-humans. A command word creates a magical bubble of air around the wearer’s head and allows normal breathing underwater until the command word is spoken again.'

'(FPR)
When the command word is spoken and the horn sounded
column21: a 40 ft cone of sonic energy deals 5d6 damage and deafens targets for 2d6 rounds. Saving throw vs wand negates deafening effect and halves damage. Any crystalline object within the area of effect takes 7d6 damage with no save allowed. The horn can be used as a musical instrument but if the blasting effect is used more than once within a 24 hour period there is a cumulative 20% chance the horn will explode
column22: dealing 10d6 points of damage to the user (no save).'

column21:
'(FPR)
As the horn of blasting above
column22: but damage is increased to 10d6 points
column23: the targets are stunned for 1 round and deafened for 4d6 rounds. A save vs wands reduces damage by half and negates stunning and deafening. If this horn explodes
column24: 20d6 points of damage are dealt to the user (no save).'

column20:
'(any)
Creates a thick
column21: vision obscuring fog covering a 10 ft cube starting next to the user and increasing 10 ft in a straight line each round the horn is blown. The fog can be blocked by any substantial structure such as a wall. The fog begins dissipating after 3 rounds and a moderate wind will disperse the fog in 4 rounds
column22: a strong wind in 1 round.'

column20:
'(CP)
Depending on the owner’s alignment
column21: blowing this brass horn will produce either a <i>protection from evil
column22: 10 ft radius for good aligned users or protection from good
column23: 10 ft radius for evil aligned users. In either case
column24: the duration of the spell-like effect is 1 hour. A neutral individual gains no benefit from sounding the horn.'

column20:
'(DM)
When sounded
column21: the horn of the tritons grants one of the following three powers
column22:
per the user’s choice.
  • Calm Waters: Rough waters within a 1 mile radius of the horn will immediately be calmed. This power can also be used to dispel a water elemental
column23:
though the elemental gets a saving throw vs magic wands.
  • Summon Monsters: Summons nearby fish and other aquatic creatures to serve the user (typically 2d6 sharks of up to 7HD). Summoned creatures will obey the summoner to the best of their ability. User must
column24: of course
column25:
be in a body of water where such creatures dwell.
  • Fear: All aquatic creatures within a 500 ft radius of the horn with an intelligence of “animal” or less must save vs wands or be afflicted with fear as per the magic user spell. A successful save means the horn had only partial effect and the creature makes all attacks and subsequent saving throws at -2.
    • The horn can be magically sounded once per day
column26: or three times per day by a triton. Any sounding of the horn can be heard by all tritons within 3 miles of the horn.'

column23: human fighters appear to fight on behalf of the summoner. There are four variations of this item listed below
column24: along with their specific powers and prerequisites. A horn of valhalla may only be magically sounded once a week. If horn is used by someone lacking the proper prerequisites the summoned fighters will attack the user. The summoned fighters are equipped with mailshirts
column25: shields
column26: helms
column27: spears
column28: and hand or battle axes. They will obey the orders of the summoner and fight until they or their opponents are slain

or 1 hour has elapsed.

column20:
'(any hoofed animal)
An animal shod with four of these magic items increases land travelling speed by 30 ft with a proportional increase to jumping distances.'

'(any hoofed animal)
An animal shod with four of these magic items moves approximately 4-6 in above any roughly horizontal surface. This allows travel over water or other unstable or non-solid surfaces. An animal shod with the horseshoes of the zephyr leaves no tracks.'

'(C)
If a cleric meditates for spells while burning the incense of meditation
column21: any spells gained will have their maximum stated effects (so a cure light wounds spell would heal 8hp regardless of the roll). The incense does not alter target saving throws.'

column20:
'(any)
A small metal cube approximately the size of a standard d6. When activated with the command word the cube takes 1 round to grow into a metal tower 20 ft square at the base and walls that are 30 ft high and extend another 10 ft into the ground. The tower will have arrow slits on all four sides and a crenellated battlement at the top. The door of the fortress will face the user and will easily open to his or her command; no other force of strength or magic will cause the door to open. The tower has 100 hit points and resists the first 20 points of damage from each attack. Damage to the fortress can only be repaired by means of a wish or miracle
column21: up to 50 points per spell. Anyone standing near the cube at activation and struck by the rapid growth of the fortress takes 10d6 points of damage
column22:
save allowed vs petrifaction for half damage.

Deactivation of the fortress is by means of a command word
column23: separate from the activation command word
column24: and the fortress cannot be deactivated unless empty.'

column22: '<style type=text/css>table {border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;} td
column23:
th{padding: 3px}(any)
These are magical crystals that orbit the user’s head at a distance of 1d3 ft and grant various benefits. The stones each have an AC -5
column24: 10 hp
column25:
and ignore the first 5 points of damage from all attacks. Ioun stones may be stored at will but will grant no benefits unless circling the user’s head.
ColourShapeEffect
ClearSpindleSustains user without food or water
Dusty RosePrism+1 AC
Deep RedSphere+1 dexterity
Incandescent BlueSphere+1 wisdom
Pale BlueRhomboid+1 strength
PinkRhomboid+1 constitution
Pink & GreenSphere+1 charisma
Scarlet & BlueSphere+1 intelligence
Dark BlueRhomboid+1 experience level
Vibrant PurplePrismStores 3 levels of spells*
IridescentSpindleSustains user without air
Pale LavenderEllipsoidAbsorbs 4th level spells or lower**
Pearly WhiteSpindleRegenerate 1 hp per hour
Pale GreenPrismUser blessed as 1st level cleric spell
OrangePrism+2 to all saving throws
Lavender & GreenEllipsoidAbsorb spells 8th level or lower***
*Spells can only be stored by a spell-caster casting them
column26: but once placed in the stone
column27:
a spell can be used by anybody.
**After absorbing 20 levels of spells the stone burns out
column28: turning into an inert and worthless dull grey rock. Absorption is not automatic
column29:
the user must be aware of the spell attack and must will the spell absorption.
***After absorbing 50 levels of spells the stone burns out
column30: turning into an inert and worthless dull grey rock. Absorption is not automatic
column31: the user must be aware of the spell attack and must will the spell absorption.'

a spell can be used by anybody.

column28: turning into an inert and worthless dull grey rock. Absorption is not automatic

column20:
'(any)
A 3 in diameter rusty iron sphere wrapped about with iron bands. To use this object
column21: the command word is spoken and the sphere thrown at a target of up to 10 ft long or tall. A successful attack causes the target to be held fast in bands of iron. The bands can be broken
column22: but only by a creature of great strength (19 or higher). Usable once per day.'

column20:
'(CDM)
This cold iron container is inscribed around with runes of great power and is sealed with a brass stopper inlaid with arcane symbols and ancient sigils. The owner of the flask can command any extra-planar creature short of demigod power within 60 ft into the flask by speaking the command word. Only one creature at a time can be so contained. The various magic symbols on the flask negate any magic resistance the creature may have
column21: but there is a slight chance (1 in 20) the creature can evade entrapment. Loosing the stopper on the flask frees the creature inside. If the command word is not spoken when the stopper is removed
column22: the creature will react to being freed according to its natural inclination
column23: probably attacking the user. If the command word is spoken when the stopper is removed the creature is bound into the remover’s service for the period of 1 hour
column24:
after which it is banished back to its home plane for the period of a year and a day. It is unwise to attempt to recapture the creature at the end of its service; the creature gains a cumulative +2 to its saving throw and will be implacably hostile to the user. This means at the end of its year and a day banishment it will return to deal with its tormentor in any way it sees fit.

A newly-discovered bottle may already have a being impri­soned.'

column20:
'(AFPR)
Like a hunting bird of prey
column21: the command word will cause this missile weapon to launch itself from the wielder’s hand. The attacking javelin is +5 to hit and damage
column22: and strikes up to 60 ft away with no “to hit” penalty. The hunting cry of a hawk can be heard when this weapon launches. Hit or miss
column23: the javelin vanishes after its attack is resolved. This item is usually found in sets of 1d6+2.'

column20:
'(CDIM)
A hooded lantern
column21: the light of which reveals all invisible objects and creatures within 25 ft. Note: invisibility is not removed. The magic invisibility is merely negated while the light of the lantern is shining on the object or creature.'

column20:
'(any)
The music of this stringed instrument negates all attacks which deal damage to inanimate construction (such as castle walls) within 300 ft. This includes magic based attacks like disintegrate or horn of blasting as well as physical attacks from a battering ram or catapult missile. This function can be used once per day for up to 30 minutes. In addition to defence
column21: once per week the lyre can also be used for construction. Once per week the music of the lyre of building can magically build walls
column22: tunnels
column23: mines
column24: ditches
column25: even complete buildings. Playing 30 minutes of magical music from the lyre is equal to 100 human beings working for 3 days. After an hour of playing in this manner 1d20 is rolled and the player must roll 18-20 to continue playing
column26: with an additional check every hour.'

column20:
'(CD)
An overgarment
column21: suitable for wearing over clothing or armour
column22: which allows the wearer to ignore the first 5 points of damage from each physical or magical attack.'

column20:
'(any)
An overgarment
column21: suitable for wearing over clothing or armour
column22: which grants 50% magic resistance. The target can still make normal saving throws and magic resistance applies only to spells and spell-like abilities; an attack from a +3 weapon would still have an attack and damage bonus of 3.'

column20:
'(any)
Reading and following the health and fitness tips in this book for six days permanently increases the constitution ability score of the reader by +1.'

'(any)
Reading and following the body-building regimen in this book for six days permanently increases the strength ability score of the reader by +1.'

'(any)
Reading and following the coordination drills and balancing exercises in this book over the course of six days permanently increases the dexterity ability score of the reader by +1.'

'(any)
Magical paints that allow the user to draw and thereby create real three dimensional objects. The user must concentrate as he or she draws and creation of an object with the pigments takes about 10 minutes. One pot of marvellous pigments is sufficient to create a 1
column21: 000 cubic ft object. Pigments can be used to create many inanimate objects such as normal weapons
column22: armour
column23: even food—generally objects with a value of less than 2
column24: 000 gp. The general appearance of expensive items such as gems or gold jewellery can be created with the pigments but the objects will be only be cheap costume jewellery type imitations. The pigments cannot create magical items of any sort
column25: and they cannot create living creatures
column26: undead
column27: golems
column28: or other monsters of any kind.'

column20:
'(AIMT)
An ivory mask skilfully carved to resemble a human skull. Once per day the wearer can command the mask to attack a target up to 50 ft away. The mask attacks with the same hit probability of the wearer and the target must save vs death magic or be slain on the spot. Even if the target makes his or her saving throw he or she must still take 3d6+13 points of damage. After resolving its single attack the mask flies back to the owner. The mask of the skull is AC 0
column21: hp 10
column22: and must be worn for a minimum of one hour before it can be commanded to attack.'

column21:
'(any giant)
This sturdy digging tool is 10 ft long and can only be properly wielded by creatures at least 20 ft tall or long. In the hands of such a being the mattock can dig earth or knock down earthen works such as ramparts
column22: taking 10 minutes to move 10 cubic ft of earth. It can also serve as a weapon
column23: attacking as a warhammer and dealing 4d6 points of base damage on a successful hit.'

column21:
'(any giant)
An 8 ft long mallet which serves as a +3 weapon (base 1d10 damage) and can be used to attack inanimate objects
column22: such as a castle wall. The maul can break through a mortared-stone structure in 1 turn
column23: or an un-mortared one in 1 round. The maul of the titans requires a minimum strength of 18 to wield properly or else the user suffers a -4 to attack rolls.'

column20:
'(IM)
A necklace which grants the wearer ESP as the 2nd level magic user spell of the same name.'

'(CM)
A magical trap in the guise of a 4 ft square mirror activated by hanging it on a wall and speaking the command word. Any creature within 30 ft of the activated mirror and unaware of the mirror’s true nature will see his or her reflection and be pulled bodily into the mirror. A saving throw vs petrifaction is allowed to avoid imprisonment. The trapped character leaves all carried and worn items behind and will be imprisoned in 1 of 15 extra-planar cells.

While imprisoned
column21: the character is in stasis and requires no food
column22: drink or air. He or she loses any innate powers or spell-like abilities. Creatures aware of the mirror’s true nature and seeking to avoid being trapped can approach the mirror and attempt to avoid seeing their reflection with a 50% chance of success; a blindfold or similar increases the chance to 100%. Size is not a factor to the mirror’s trapping ability
column23: but golems and unintelligent undead
column24: as well as any other inanimate matter
column25: cannot be trapped. There are various command words for the mirror of life trapping. Besides the activation command
column26:
there is a deactivation command which allows the owner to safely approach the mirror.

Each imprisoned creature has two further command words associated with it. One will call the creature’s reflection to the surface of the mirror and allow the owner to converse with the powerless captive. The second command word will free the prisoner. If the number of prisoners held within the mirror exceeds 15
column27: a randomly determined captive will be freed to make room for the new one. Breaking the mirror will free all captives held within—but it should be noted here that not all liberated prisoners may be kindly-disposed towards those who granted them freedom. The GM should determine the quantity and nature of prisoners held by the mirror of life trapping before placing it into the campaign world.'

column20:
'(M)
A powerful scrying device in the form of a 5 ft tall and 2 ft wide mirror. Through the use of command words
column21:
the following powers are available.
  • Mind Reading: If the owner is within 25 ft of the mirror
column22:
he can read the thoughts of any living creature reflected therein as with the magic user spell ESP regardless of whether he or she understands the being’s language.
  • Distance Viewing: The owner can view distant locations as with a clairvoyance spell. This includes other planes of existence if the user is familiar with them.
  • Portal: The mirror can be used as a direct portal to locations seen in the mirror. The user merely steps through the mirror and into the other location. Any companions of the owner may accompany him or her. An invisible door remains open for 24 hours
column23: until the owner steps back through
column24:
or until the owner uses the command word to close it. Any being in the presence of the invisible portal with an intelligence of 12 or better has a chance of detecting it with the same probability of detecting a scrying attempt.
  • Sage Advice: Once a week the mirror can accurately answer a short question about any creature looking into the mirror.'

column20:
'(M)
Upon activation by command word
column21: this 4 ft tall by 3 ft wide mirror can create a hostile duplicate of anyone looking into the mirror. The duplicate will step through and immediately engage the original in a fight to the death. The opposite will have all the equipment
column22: ability and knowledge of the original. When the fight is over
column23: and whether the duplicate won or lost
column24: the reflected opponent and items disappear. The mirror can function up to four times per day.'

column20:
'(any)
Magic jewellery which surrounds the wearer with a bubble of fresh
column21: breathable air. This negates the effects of poisonous vapours and gasses
column22: including spell effects such as cloudkill
column23: and even allows breathing underwater or in hard vacuum.'

column21: '<style type=text/css>table {border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;} td
column22:
th{padding: 3px}(DM)
The beads of this necklace can easily be detached by the wearer only and hurled up to 70 ft. Upon reaching its target the bead explodes as a fireball; the target is allowed a saving throw vs spells for half damage. The fireball beads come in a variety of strengths and most necklaces have a combination of different strength fireballs. If the wearer suffers damage from a magical fire attack he or she must immediately save vs breath weapon at +5 or all remaining beads on the necklace spontaneously detonate with the area of effect centred on the wearer.
Necklace10d69d68d67d66d65d64d63d62d6
Type I—————1—2—
Type II————1—2—2
Type III———1—2—4—
Type IV——1—2—2—4
Type V—1—2—2—2—
Type VI1—2—2—4——
Type VII12—2—2—2—
'

If the wearer suffers damage from a magical fire attack he or she must immediately save vs breath weapon at +5 or all remaining beads on the necklace spontaneously detonate with the area of effect centred on the wearer.

column20:
'(any)
This item appears as a container of standard lamp oil. When burned the aroma given off will cause all creatures within 60 ft to become famished. The smoke must have a chance to accumulate in order to work
column21: so if the oil is burned outside it will be of little effect beyond giving the user a robust hunger. In subterranean settings
column22: however
column23: the oil of famishing will work its insidious magic. Within 1d4+1 rounds of lighting the oil
column24: the adventurers will ignore everything but the most dire of threats in order to break out their field rations or iron rations and sate their hunger. Nearby monsters will rush toward the humans and demi-humans in order to feast upon the intruders. All living creatures within the area of effect will be compelled to eat for at least 1 round
column25: and each round thereafter an affected creature will gain a saving throw.'

column20:
'(CD)
An 8 in glass sphere which enables the owner to control weather as the spell once daily. Once per month the bearer of the orb can completely change the weather into a mighty storm. A mighty storm creates a giant black thunder-head with giant flashes of lightning and booming thunder
column21: with the following effects per round. (Note: ranged attacks and spell casting within the area of the storm are impossible due to the violent weather conditions. The owner of the orb is also protected from any natural weather conditions
column22:
including extreme heat or cold.)
  • 1st Round: Anyone under the cloud must save vs spells or be deafened by the thunder for 1d4 × 10 minutes.
  • 2nd Round: Acid rain pelts down upon the unlucky victims
column23:
dealing 1d6 points of damage. No save allowed.
  • 3rd Round: Lightning strikes
column24:
up to six 10d6 bolts. No target may be hit by more than one bolt.
  • 4th Round: Hailstones deal 5d6 points bludgeoning damage to targets
column25:
no save.
  • 5th-10th Rounds: Violent rain and wind gusts reduce visibility to 5 ft
column26: including all types of low light vision. Attacks upon creatures within 5 ft are at -4
column27: attacks on creatures farther away are at -10 and sight cannot be used to locate target.'

column20:
'(any)
An expensive-appearing pearl which
column21: when grasped in the hand or held to the breast
column22: grants the ability to breathe underwater
column23: swim at movement rate 60 ft
column24: and speak or cast spells underwater without penalty.'

column20:
'(any)
A magical necklace granting immunities to all diseases
column21: including magical or supernatural diseases.'

column20:
'(any)
A magical necklace granting immunity to poison
column21: though any poison in the wearer’s system before using the periapt will still be active.'

column20:
'(any)
A magical necklace which increases the wearer’s wisdom by +1.'

'(any)
A magical necklace which will automatically stabilise the wearer’s condition if his or her hit points drop below zero (-1 to -9). The periapt also doubles the wearer’s normal healing rate and allows a normal rate of healing to wounds which do not normally permit this (e.g. damage from a bleeding sword).'

'(CP)
This sacred headband enables the wearer to know whether any action he or she is contemplating will adversely affect his or her alignment and his or her standing with his or her deity. The phylactery will even allow him or her to detect magical items which could change his or her alignment. To use the phylactery
column21: the user must first take a moment to contemplate his or her proposed actions.'

column20:
'(CP)
This blessed headband allows any character with the ability to turn undead to perform that action as if he or she were four levels higher.'

'(any)
This magical set of pan pipes can be used twice per day to produce music which scares (per the 2nd level magic user spell) anyone within 30 ft who has less than 6 HD. A saving throw vs spells is allowed to avoid the effect.'

'(any)
A magic instrument which will cause all hearing it to save vs wands or become enraptured
column21: stopping all actions and listening to the music. When the music stops the victims are cursed with an extreme sensitivity to sound and will immediately take 1d4 points of damage for 2d4 rounds unless in a completely sound-free area. After this time and until the curse is removed
column22: the least noise will cause the victim to be at -1 to AC
column23: to hit
column24: and saving throws.'

column20:
'(any)
This magical instrument can be used to summon up to 101 normal rats
column21: if any are within 400 ft. The rats take a turn to travel 50 ft and the pipes must be played continuously. When the rats arrive at the player’s location he or she will be able to command them telepathically but only so long as he or she continues to play. When the music stops the rats leave immediately.'

column20:
'(IM)
These magic pipes produce an audible glamour as the magic user spell as if cast by a 3rd level magic user.'

'(any)
The magic of this item is usually contained in a metallic flask that vaguely resembles a cornucopia if turned on its side. If its contents are drunk
column21: or poured into another container
column22: a random potion will be dispensed. Usually this item can be used but d6+1 times per week. Excessive use will drain the item of its potency
column23: typically reducing the d6+1 usage per week by one until no weekly charges remain.'

column20:
'(any)
A deep black cloth that
column21: when unfolded onto a flat surface
column22: forms a 6 ft diameter and 10 ft deep hole. Items placed in the hole are stored safely and the cloth is of negligible weight when folded up
column23: regardless of the weight of its contents. The portable hole can be closed by taking the edges of the cloth and folding it up. This can be done from without or within the hole. Folded up
column24: there is enough air for 1 medium or 2 small creatures for about 10 minutes. The extra-planar space of a portable hole is not compatible with similar devices
column25: such as a bag of holding. If either of these items is placed within the other
column26: see the entry under bag of holding to determine the effects.'

column20:
'(any)
A palm-sized jar contains 5 uses of ointment. One application will neutralise any poison or heal any disease suffered by the person receiving the application. If applied to a wound
column21: the ointment will restore 1d8+5 points of damage.'

column20:
'(any)
Paired 18 in diameter iron rings. When the pair are located on the same plane of existence and within 100 miles of each other
column21: anything pushed through one ring will at once come out of the other ring. Up to 100 lbs of material can pass through in one day
column22: though items partially pushed through then retracted (a hand
column23: for instance) will not count against the total. Anything small enough to pass through the gate can do so
column24: including small living creatures. Attacks
column25: messages
column26: and spells
column27: can pass through the gate as well. The entry and exit side of both rings are plainly marked.'

column21:
'(IM)
A magical garment which grants various powers to arcane and phantasmal spellcasters. The wearer’s alignment must match that of the robe
column22: as indicated by colour. Type of robe and probability (d%) of appearance: white for good alignment (01-45); grey for true neutrals (46-75); black for evil mages (76-100). A good or evil character wearing a robe of the opposite alignment incurs permanent level loss of -2 (give the character sufficient xp to place him or her at the very beginning of the level two levels below his or her current one). A good or evil character wearing a neutral robe
column23:
or a neutral character wearing a black or white robe incurs a temporary 2 level penalty (only while the robe is worn). Any arcane spellcaster wearing any robe of the magi gains the powers listed below.
  • AC +5
  • 75% magic resistance
  • +4 to saving throws
  • The wearer is treated as if he or she were one level higher for the purposes of overcoming a target’s magic resistance.
'

column21:
'(IM)
A magical garment which grants various powers to arcane and phantasmal spellcasters. The wearer’s alignment must match that of the robe
column22: as indicated by colour. Type of robe and probability (d%) of appearance: white for good alignment (01-45); grey for true neutrals (46-75); black for evil mages (76-100). A good or evil character wearing a robe of the opposite alignment incurs permanent level loss of -2 (give the character sufficient xp to place him or her at the very beginning of the level two levels below his or her current one).   • 75% magic resistance

'

'(IM)
A magical garment which grants various powers to arcane and phantasmal spellcasters. The wearer’s alignment must match that of the robe
column22: as indicated by colour. Type of robe and probability (d%) of appearance: white for good alignment (01-45); grey for true neutrals (46-75); black for evil mages (76-100). '

column20:
'(IM)
Magical robes which communicate to the wearer its power. Anyone wearing the robe of blending is 75% unlikely to be detected if stationary
column21: 50% in motion. The robe also allows the wearer to change self at will
column22: as per the spell. Any person or creature friendly to the wearer
column23: however
column24: will see him or her as he or she really is.'

column20:
'(IM)
An enchanted robe bearing a variety of tokens visible to and recognizable only by the wearer. One token can be detached per round
column21:
causing the token to become the type of undead it resembles. The created monster will not automatically be under the control of the wearer but will be subject to normal forms of control or command.

A complete robe of bones will have two of each of the following tokens attached: Goblin skeleton
column22: Human skeleton
column23: Wolf skeleton
column24: Goblin zombie
column25: Human zombie
column26: Wolf zombie.'

column20:
'(IM)
The wearer of this magical clothing is able to see in all directions at once. The robe also grants infravision to 120 ft
column21: and can see invisible and æthereal objects within the same distance. The wearer gains a 1 in 6 better chance to locate secret or concealed doors
column22: never loses his or her dexterity bonus to AC
column23: and cannot be surprised—but also cannot avert his or her eyes to avoid a gaze attack from a creature such as a medusa. Light or con tinual light cast at the robe blinds the wearer for 1d3 rounds.'

column20:
'(IM)
An iridescent magical garment that provides constant 30 ft radius illumination. Upon command
column21: the colours of the robe begin scintillating and after 1 round the swirling colours create an effect similar to a gaze attack; anyone within 30 ft of the robe’s wearer will be dazed 1d4+1 rounds (saving throw vs staves allowed to negate effects). Undead and mindless creatures are immune to this effect. The scintillation effect can be used a total of 10 rounds per day.'

column20:
'(IM)
Dark-coloured robes embroidered with silver or white stars. This magical garment allows the wearer
column21: and everything he or she is wearing or carrying
column22: to enter the Astral Plane. The robes also grant a +1 bonus to all saving throws. Last
column23: the wearer can use up to 6 of the embroidered stars as +5 darts and he can throw them as if proficient in their use. A dart so used disappears after the attack is resolved.'

column20: '<style type=text/css>table {border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;} td
column21:
th{padding: 3px}(IM)
An enchanted robe bearing a variety of tokens visible to and recognisable only by the wearer. One token can be detached per round
column22:
causing the token to become the item depicted. A removed patch cannot be reattached.

A complete robe always has 2 of each of following items:
  • Bullseye lantern
column23:
filled and lit
  • Steel mirror
column24:
2 ft × 4 ft
  • Pole
column25:
10 ft
  • Rope
column26:
50 ft hemp
  • Sack
    • The robe will also have a random selection of 4d4 additional patches. Use the table below. Multiple items of the same type are possible.
    d%Result
    01-07Ash tree
column27: 40 ft high08-16Bag of 100 gold pieces17Bonfire19-21Cask: d8
column28: 1-2 empty
column31: 8 brandy22-25Coffer
column34: iron*38-41Gems
column36: 12 ft long46-50Mule with saddle bags51-55Pick
column37: standard mining56-59Pit
column38: open (10 ft × 10 ft × 10 ft)60-66Portable ram67-74Potion of extra-healing75-80Rations
column39: standard

column43: up to 10 ft × 10 ft in size
column44: and barred on one side. It must be placed upright
column45:
after which it attaches and hinges itself automatically.
**One randomly-determined spell of 1st-3rd level.'

column20:
'(any)
A thin and strong 60 ft length of rope that can support up to 3
column21: 000 lbs. The rope will become animated upon command
column22: climbing or otherwise moving at a rate of 10 ft per round and attaching itself to any point the user commands. The rope can also be commanded to detach itself and return to its owner. The rope also has the ability to knot itself at 10 ft intervals to permit non-thieves to climb it but doing so shortens the available length of rope to 50 ft. At least one end of the rope must be held for the rope’s magic to work.'

column20:
'(AFPRT)
This item appears as an ordinary 30 ft long hemp rope. The rope can be commanded to entangle any victim up to 20 ft away or 10 ft above. The entangled victim must successfully roll a bend iron bars on the strength table to escape. The rope has an AC of -2 and 12 hp. The rope of entanglement resists the first 5 points of damage from all slashing attacks and can repair itself at a rate of 1 hp every 5 minutes. If the rope reaches zero hit points it is permanently destroyed.'
'<style type=text/css>table {border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;} td
column21:
th{padding: 3px}(A)
This magical book grants the reader one complete level of experience
column22:
provided he or she is of the correct class. Determine which class the volume enhances according to the following table:
d10Class
1Assassin
2Cleric
3Druid
4Fighter
5Illusionist
6Magic user
7Paladin
8Ranger
9Thief
10Re-roll
The experience gained is sufficient to put the character at the start point of his or her next level. If a character of the incorrect class reads a Sagacious Volume
column23: he or she loses 20

column20:
'(AFPRT)
This weapon scabbard will magically change size to fit an edged weapon as small as a dagger or as large as a two-handed sword. Thrice per day the scabbard can cause the weapon normally carried within it to gain +2 to attack and damage for 10 combat rounds; during the enchantment such a weapon will cause double damage on an unmodified attack roll of 19 or 20.'

'(any)
This beetle shaped pin allows the possessor to detect any golem of any type within 60 ft. He or she must concentrate for a round to use this power. The scarab also allows the wearer to attack and damage any golem with any weapon
column21: including non-magical ones.'

column20:
'(any)
A beetle shaped pin that
column21: if held or worn for at least 1 round
column22: communicates its ability to the person holding it. The scarab will absorb any death magic (being magic that directly causes death
column23: such as a death spell — petrifaction effects
column24: for example
column25: or effects that kill through hp loss rather than instant death
column26: are unaffected)
column27: energy draining attacks
column28: or negative energy effects directed at the wearer. After absorbing 12 such attacks
column29: the scarab crumbles into worthless powder.'

column20:
'(C)
When a body is wrapped in these finely made burial clothes
column21: a command word will cause the body to disintegrate into dust. The shrouds function only once. Intelligent undead creatures such as vampires are permitted a saving throw
column22: and the shrouds cannot be employed in combat.'

column20:
'(any)
A viscous liquid. When applied to a weapon
column21: silversheen bestows the ability for the weapon to hit any creature
column22: negating any immunities (a werewolf may be hit with a regular sword
column23: for instance). One application lasts for 1 hour and a vial contains enough to coat a single melee weapon or 20 units of ammunition.'

column20:
'(any)
Supple footwear that grants the ability for the wearer to climb all surfaces and even move upside down across ceilings at a rate of 20 ft. The wearer is “hands free” when climbing with the slippers. Any condition which would make normal walking on a horizontal surface hazardous
column21: e.g. ice
column22: grease
column23: or oil of slipperiness
column24: will render the slippers useless. The slippers can be used 10 minutes cumulative per 24 hour day.'

column20:
'(any)
Simply put
column21: this glue will stick anything to anything else
column22: permanently. A vial of sovereign glue will contain 1d8-1 (minimum 1) oz of glue. A single oz will coat up to 1 sq ft of surface and once items are glued together the bond requires a round to set. Before the binding is set the items can be separated
column23: rendering that application of sovereign glue worthless. After the bond is allowed to set the bond is permanent
column24: though the glue can be dissolved with universal solvent. When glue is removed from the vial 1 oz of oil of slipperiness must be added to the glue container within 1 round
column25: or the glue will set inside the container and be useless.'

column20:
'(any)
When the command word is spoken
column21: this 3 in square stone cube affixes itself to an object. Thereafter
column22: anyone touching the object without first speaking the command word will cause the stone to emit an ear-piercing shriek of alarm for a complete round which can be heard up to a quarter mile away.'

column20:
'(DM)
A fist-sized irregular lump of rock that
column21: on command
column22: summons a 12HD earth elemental that appears in 1d4 rounds and fights the owner’s foes to the best of its ability. In all other respects the stone’s magic is as a conjure elemental spell. Only one elemental may be summoned at a time and another cannot be called until the first is slain
column23: dispelled
column24: or dismissed.'

column20:
'(any)
Also known as the luckstone
column21: this item grants +1 to all saving throws and “to hit” rolls.'

'(any)
Appears as a life-sized statue of a stone horse of one of two types; a draft horse or a heavy war horse
column22: animated by a command word. Both types can carry up to 1
column23: 000 lbs
column24: never need rest or food
column25: and can attack as a real horse of their respective types. Damage to the stone horse can be repaired by feeding it gems
column26: restoring 1 hp for each 50 gp worth of gems it consumes. The stone horse can also be healed by casting stone to flesh upon it to turn it into a flesh and blood horse
column27: then healing it using standard methods or spells. When the horse reaches its maximum hit points
column28: it reverts back to stone form. Stone horses are AC 0 and a stone horse reaching zero hit points shatters into worthless dust and rock

column21:
'(any)
Appears as a life-sized statue of a stone horse of one of two types; a draft horse or a heavy war horse
column22: animated by a command word. Both types can carry up to 1
column23: 000 lbs
column24: never need rest or food
column25: and can attack as a real horse of their respective types. Damage to the stone horse can be repaired by feeding it gems
column26: restoring 1 hp for each 50 gp worth of gems it consumes. The stone horse can also be healed by casting stone to flesh upon it to turn it into a flesh and blood horse
column27: then healing it using standard methods or spells. When the horse reaches its maximum hit points
column28: it reverts back to stone form. Stone horses are AC 0 and a stone horse reaching zero hit points shatters into worthless dust and rock

column20:
'(any)
A vial contains 1d4+1 ounces. The salve can be applied to a petrified creature
column21: restoring it to flesh as does a stone to flesh spell. 1 oz will restore a creature the size of a typical human.'
'<style type=text/css>table {border-style: solid; border-width: 1px;} td
column22:
th{padding: 3px}(C)
A cleric carrying or holding the prayer beads will intuitively know the powers they grant and how to use the beads as soon as he or she casts a spell. Each strand has at least two beads on it
column23:
granting a different power according to the table below.
Bead TypeAbility Granted
BlessingCast bless spell
HealingCast choice of cure serious wounds
column24: cure blindness or deafness
column25: or cure diseaseKarmaCast spells at +4 user level of ability for 10 roundsSmitingCast spiritual weapon
column26: flame strike
column27: or cause blindnessSummonsSummons extraplanar ally appropriate to caster’s alignment*Wind WalkingCast wind walk*Creatures summoned might be demons or devils but never a deity. Misusing this bead by summoning a divine ally for trivial reasons may incur the wrath of the cleric’s deity
column28:
along with a geas to teach the character humility and wisdom.
  • Lesser Strand of Prayer Beads: Bead of blessing
column29:
bead of healing.
  • Strand of Prayer Beads: Beads of healing
column31:
and smiting.
  • Greater Strand of Prayer Beads: Beads of healing
column34: and wind walking.The following beads are activated by a command word: blessing
column36: smiting
column37: and wind walking. The beads of karma and summons can be activated by any character capable of casting divine magic spells simply by willing it. All beads except for the bead of summons can be used once per day. The bead of summons disappears after 1 use. If a bead is removed from the strand it immediately and forever loses its power. The beads need not be worn by the cleric but he or she must have them somewhere on his or her person.'

column20:
'(any)
Placing this magical spoon into an empty bowl will cause the bowl to fill with a bland but nourishing gruel capable of sustaining any 1 living creature for 1 day. Up to four such servings can produced in any 1 day.'

'(AFPR)
A +2 melee weapon with a blue steel head. When hurled as a missile the spear becomes a bolt of blue lightning and incurs no “to hit” penalty for up to 70 ft. If the spear strikes its target it inflicts 1d6+2 points of physical damage and 22 points of electrical damage
column21: no save allowed. The lightning bolt will also reflect back half the distance it was thrown
column22: damaging any creature within 5 ft of the bolt for 10 points of damage
column23: saving throw vs aimed magic items for 1⁄2 damage allowed. These weapons get their name from the sound of far away thunder heard when they are thrown. Thunder spears are usually found in pairs.'

column20:
'(any)
A character studying this book a minimum of 48 hours over the course of a single week and diligently performing the mental exercises contained within its pages will gain 1 point of permanent increase to his or her intelligence score. The tome vanishes forever after 1 use.'

'(any)
A character studying this book a minimum of 48 hours over the course of a single week and diligently practising the leadership methods contained within its pages will gain 1 point of permanent increase to his or her charisma score. This book vanishes forever after 1 use.'

'(any)
A character studying this book a minimum of 48 hours over the course of a single week and diligently pondering the logic puzzles and ethical dilemmas contained within its pages will gain 1 point of permanent increase to his or her wisdom score. This book vanishes forever after 1 use.'

'(any)
When applied to any formerly living matter
column21: this unguent slows the effect of time upon that object
column22: such that a year’s passing ages the item but a day. The item gains +1 to all saving throws. The unguent does not wear off
column23: though its magic can be dispelled. One vial of unguent of timelessness can coat 8 normal-sized objects.'

column20:
'(any)
This solvent will unstick anything glued or rusted together
column21: including items joined together with sovereign glue. Universal solvent is always found in a blue and yellow container.'

column20:
'(AT)
This silk waistcoat contains magically concealed secret compartments holding lockpicks which grant a +20% bonus to a thief or assassin’s open lock chance. Only the wearer of the vest can detect the compartments; to all others they cannot be located by even the most thorough of searches.'

column21:
'(D)
A lightweight overgarment which is generally green with woodland designs. Any druid with shapeshift ability wearing the vestment will gain an extra use of that ability per day.'

column20:
'(any)
This item looks just like a portable hole but instead of creating a hole it creates an opening into another plane of existence
column21: determined randomly each time the well is opened. The well is two-way
column22: meaning creatures or objects from whatever plane it contacts can enter the Prime Material Plane just as easily as objects pass through to the other plane from the Prime Material.'

column20:
'(any)
A magical hand fan which
column21: upon command
column22: creates a gust of wind as the spell. The fan can be used once per day without risk; additional uses in a day garner a 20% cumulative chance of destroying the fan.'

column20:
'(any)
Upon command
column21: this cape will transform itself into a pair of wings
column22: allowing the wearer to fly at 60 ft movement rate (aerial agility level IV). When in cape form the wings of flying take on a variety of styles and appearances and the wings formed can be either feathered or bat-wing style.'

column20:
'(any)
Identify will falsely indicate this item grants the wearer immunity from detection
column21: location
column22: and mind-reading. Once donned
column23: however
column24: the item changes from a normal appearing gold amulet with gemstone inlay into a rather large and garish piece of cheap costume jewellery. Anyone wearing the amulet of inescapable location will be 50% less likely to save vs scrying and divination spells.'

column20:
'(CFPR)
This armour appears to both mundane and magical inspection as a strongly magicked suit of plate armour. Only in actual use
column21: however
column22: will its cursed nature be revealed. The armour will function as a magical set of armour +3 against melee attacks but against any ranged attack it imposes -3 penalty to AC. After the armour reveals its true nature a red and white set of three concentric circles appear on the breastplate
column23: over the wearer’s heart.'

column20:
'(CFPR)
Resembling armour of command
column21: when worn this plate +1 will cause a -4 penalty to the wearer’s charisma.'

column20:
'(any)
This item appears as an everyday sack and mystical means of identification will indicate it is a bag of holding. The bag of devouring actually has the same capacity for storage as a regular bag of holding but in fact the bag is a lure and feeding orifice for an extradimensional creature. Some say this horror is the result of an evil mage’s twisted experiment on a trapped mimic
column21: or perhaps a doppelgänger
column22:
but even the wisest of sages cannot say with any certainty.

The bag of devouring senses any intrusion of vegetable or animal matter
column23: such as an adventurer’s arm
column24: into the bag—though 90% of the time it will ignore the initial intrusion. With each subsequent introduction of living material the bag is 60% likely to grab the offending member and attempt to draw the victim inside. The bag is quite strong and the rows of teeth revealed in the attack are designed to allow a struggling creature to move inward easily but outward only with great difficulty. Treat attempts to break free as a Major Test of Strength. The character gets three such attempts; the first when initially grabbed
column25: the second at -10% when halfway inside
column26:
the last at -20% before disappearing into the creature’s maw.

Any living material drawn into the bag of devouring is entirely consumed in 1 round and thus attempts to raise or resurrect the victim which require a part of the corpse are disallowed. Due to the chaotic and other planar nature of the beast
column27: there is only a 50% chance a wish
column28: miracle
column29: or resurrection will succeed and if that check fails
column30:
the victim is irrevocably destroyed.

Though the bag of devouring can function somewhat as a bag of holding there is a cumulative 5% chance per hour of the bag swallowing its contents and spitting them out onto some randomly determined plane of existence.'

column20:
'(any)
Footwear which appears to be any one of a number of magicked boots. When the wearer is engaged in or fleeing from combat
column21: however
column22: the boots of dancing will show their true nature. The wearer will begin to dance as if the 8th magic user spell irresistible dance had been cast upon him or her for the duration of the battle. When hostilities cease
column23: if the character survived the dancing will stop until the next battle. Up until the first time the curse is revealed the boots may be removed at will but afterwards
column24: only a remove curse will free the user from this malign footwear.'

column20:
'(any)
These serve as bracers of defence +5 until the wearer is engaged in actual combat with an enemy of equal or greater level. At once the bracers lose the +5 bonus and immediately and permanently become -5 to AC. A remove curse is required to remove them once this has occurred.'

'(any)
Appears as a broom of flying to all attempts to identify. When used by speaking the command word
column21: usually found engraved on the handle
column22: the cursed nature becomes obvious. The broom will loop into the air and dump the rider on the ground
column23: then begin attacking them relentlessly. The broom gets four attacks at +5 per round
column24: striking twice at the body with the handle and twice in the face with the straw end. All attacks deal 1d6 damage and a successful hit to the face with the straw end also blinds the target for 1 round. The broom is AC -2 and absorbs 18 hit points before breaking into pieces
column25: losing all magic in the process.'

column20:
'(any)
Identify spells will reveal nothing but a rather sturdy woollen cloak. This article of clothing can be handled without harm but when worn the victim is instantly slain unless he or she rolls a save vs death. Once worn
column21: the cloak can only be removed with a remove curse spell
column22: which also completely destroys the cloak. Any means of resurrecting the victim must be preceded by a neutralise poison spell or be automatically unsuccessful.'

column20:
'(IM)
This item appears as a typical crystal ball
column21: used by many mages to assist with scrying and communication across long distances. Anyone looking into the ball will be hypnotised for 1d6 minutes
column22: during which time they will do nothing but stare into the ball
column23: enthralled by what is seen therein. When the viewer is released
column24: he or she should roll a save vs petrifaction or be convinced they viewed the desired scene or individual. Further
column25: failing to save indicates the viewer has become mentally enslaved by the actual object of the viewing
column26: a powerful lich
column27: arch-mage
column28: or perhaps even a powerful other planar figure who is secretly controlling the device. With each use of the hypnosis ball the unlucky individual falls deeper and deeper under the influence of the controlling figure
column29: until eventually the viewer becomes an extension of its will. The viewer
column31: is completely unaware of his or her waning individuality.'

column20:
'(any)
To any test
column21: this fine white powder appears to be dust of appearance. When thrown into the air this powder causes all living beings within 20 ft to be disabled by choking
column22: treat as stunned for 5d4 rounds. Each person must save vs breath weapon or take 2d6 damage from the body wracking coughs. One minute later a second save must be made to avoid an additional 1d6 points of damage. Whether one or both saves are made
column23: each person within the area of effect will be disabled by the choking effect of the powder for 2 rounds.'

column20:
'(any)
This container appears as any one of a number of containers encountered during the course of an adventure. Sometimes it looks like a potion flask
column21: sometimes as a bottle or beaker
column22: still others as a jug. Shaking the flask of curses may yield a sound as if it were filled with liquid
column23: still other times the flask may emit a thin stream of smoke. When unstoppered
column24: the flask releases a gaseous cloud which causes all within 30 ft to roll their constitution or better on 3d6 to avoid being cursed. The curse causes a -2 penalty on all attack rolls and saving throws until such times as a remove curse spell can be cast on the suffering individuals.'

column21:
'(any)
These appear to be gauntlets of two differing types
column22: suitable for use with heavy armour or made for use with leather armour or clothing. These obviously magicked articles detect for ability bonuses depending upon type. Heavy armour gauntlets of fumbling appear to increase strength to 18.99 or sometimes to increase ability +3 with a bladed weapon. Lighter versions will appear to increase the wearer’s AC by +2 or increase dexterity to 18. These gloves will perform as whatever item they are disguised as until the wearer is engaged in combat with a hostile foe or other life-or-death type situation
column23: at which time the curse manifests itself. The wearer becomes butter-fingered
column24: losing -2 dexterity
column25: and has a 50% chance each round of dropping anything held in either hand (check separately)
column26: which continues even after combat ends. Any beneficial effects of wearing the gauntlets disappear forever then the curse appears. Gauntlets of Fumbling can only be removed by means of a remove curse
column27:
or wish spell.

Gauntlets of Fumbling can only be removed by means of a remove curse
column28: or wish spell.'

column21:
'(any)
These appear to be gauntlets of two differing types
column22: suitable for use with heavy armour or made for use with leather armour or clothing. These obviously magicked articles detect for ability bonuses depending upon type. column27:
or wish spell.
